runs.comm: tossed up, swept hard past backward square leg and KP is off and running
shorter, on off stump and chopped at late, the ball squirting to square leg via a thick inside edge
full, defended to midwicket
on the stumps, worked out to deep square off the pads
given some air, swept on the front foot to midwicket
flatter, on the stumps, clipped to the man at midwicket again
length, defended in front of the stumps
bit of width and Pietersen steps out, drives hard into the wicket and fielded by the bowler
touch short, wide again and hammered through the covers
tighter line, not quite so much room for Pietersen to swing his forearms, punched wide of extra-cover
full, wide, slashed square on bended knee but straight to point
back of a length and played down on to the wicket
tossed up outside off, as Pietersen step into position across his stumps - but his lusty sweep doesn't properly connect
straighter, played down the wicket
on the stumps, clipped into the leg side
loses his line down the leg side
advances on the bowler and plays a clip to long-on
dragged short, Kieswetter punches into the gap in front of deep midwicket and the batsmen run hard for a couple
tossed up outside off, aims a slog-sweep out towards deep micwicket butdoesn't connect properly - which is lucky, because the ball drops short of the fielder
full, leg-stump attack and crumped off his pads towards deep backward square
slower ball, straight and slightly full, Pietersen lofts it back over the bowler's head. Not the cleanest connection but plenty enough to make the rope
length, on off, punched to cover
again Kieswetter connects with the toe of the bat, aiming to deposit the ball somewhere in the Persian gulf. This time it just has enough to clear midwicket running back
you could spread Kieswetter on toast, he's that jammy at the moment ... this time he slices over short third man for a boundary!
ah, a genuine stroke! Pitched up, outside off and drilled over extra-cover, one bounce to the fence
length, on the stumps, defended cautiously

Ajmal's done it again! Pietersen has been playing like Superman recently but Ajmal, dressed in green, is trickier than Kryptonite. Pietersen tried to sweep on leg stump but could only scoop the ball to short fine leg. He walks off scratching his head
on the stumps, played back to the bowler
leg side, hit on the pads
touch short, shovelled to square leg
length, on the stumps, nibbled to one side of midwicket
full, driven into the off side

and he strikes with his second ball too! The delivery was straight, on a good length and Bopara seemed to misread the line, playing around the ball and being hit on the knee roll. Might have been angling towards leg but there are no reviews in this form of the game so Bopara has to make like a tree and leave
around the wicket, speared in, defended into the on side
full, outside off and driven uppishly past extra-cover. Looked like half a chance for a catch but it quickly sped away off the surface
wide again and a more authentic square drive gives Morgan consecutive boundaries
length, on off and punched to cover off the back foot
length, tapped down the ground to long-on
played down the ground off a length
flatter, tickled square on the leg side
angled in, skidding off the surface - and was that pad first? Hafeez thinks so, Morgan trying to cut when there wasn't room. Replays show there was bat but it came second

this time he gets the decision! Morgan pushed forward to a length ball, sliding in, played around his pad and although it might have been just outside the line, umpire Raza makes up for his error on the previous delivery
over the wicket, tossed up, blocked down the wicket
googly, slanting in on off, cut late on the back foot, just in front of the stumps
tossed up a bit more, driven square towards the deep cover boundary
tossed up and chipped over the infield, a well-placed shot that beats the dive of the fielder on the boundary
angled in, quicker delivery, hit on the pad but sliding down leg
back of a length, cut to deep backward point
full, on off, driven authentically to cover
length, Kieswetter steps out and punches to extra-cover, who fields smartly, Bairstow forced to dive to regain his ground at the non-striker's end
back of a length, worked of his pads
driven back to the bowler
flat, on the stumps but Biarstow is quickly back, manufacturing a powerful pull stroke over midwicket. Lovely placement
tossed up, driven down the ground to long-off
on the stumps, clipped to long-on
room outside off, cut hard behind point
shot! tossed up googly and Bairstow swings the meat of the bat through it on the full, pinging it down the ground
outside off, length ball stroked to cover
this time Kieswetter goes big! Flighted, on leg and heaved over deep midwicket

Afridi gets his revenge, Kieswetter caught in the deep! The ball was tossed up outside off and Kieswetter fell victim to a sugar rush, scooping the ball high but not far enough, the catch taken at long-off
on the stumps, defended
short from round the wicket, cut away in front of deep cover
on leg stump, tucked to the right of midwicket
tossed up a little more to Patel who comes onto the front foot then works it along the ground to deep square leg
wonderful strike from Bairstow as he drills a full delivery back past the non-striker's stumps with the timing to split long-off and long-on. Gem of a shot
worked down the ground to long-off
quicker ball outside off, Patel on the back foot opens the face and runs it behind point
back of a length on off stump and dropped square on the off side
stands tall in the crease and drives a good-length delivery on the up straight to cover
doesn't time this, stops a fraction in the surface as he tries to drive and it lobs back towards the bowler
slower ball drifts into the pads, Bairstow can't take advantage and he's through his shot early. The ball dribbles to the on side. Patel almost collides with Cheema taking the leg bye
fire down the leg side
another dot ball adds to the pressure on Patel...tight on off stump and Patel can only push it to the leg side
loses his line again down the leg side and that gifts England another extra and another delivery
pounds the pitch back of a length, Patel struggling for his timing and drives to mid-off who is inside the circle
tucked neatly off around middle stump through the vacant short fine-leg area
backs away to expose his stumps then cuts to find deep cover
sharp turn this time, Patel waits on the back foot having stepped to leg and forces it square on the off side
angled towards the pads but Bairstow can't take advantage and it rolls to short fine leg
full on leg stump, Bairstow aims through midwicket but gets an inside edge towards deep square
that looked like the doosra, Bairstow squared up a touch as he plays into the off side
quick delivery, quick footwork and quick hands. Patel steps to leg and cuts out to deep cover
he also plays back and pushes to cover
power and placement this time...dragged down short from Afridi, the ball sat up and Bairstow pulled it strongly through midwicket
fired in at the pads and Bairstow doesn't make contact
wider outside off, Bairstow drives with an open face to play it wide of deep cover
another quicker, flatter, ball which Bairstow tries to pull but it comes off a bottom edge to short fine leg
all three stumps were shown to the bowler as Patel stepped away, but he middled is cut out to the cover sweeper
that is a classy shot. Ajmal round the wicket, Bairstow uses his feet to come down the pitch outside leg then drives it wide of long-off
comes down the pitch again but can only push it back to Ajmal. Cracking little contest
brings out the reverse sweep, taken from well outside leg through square cover
useful edge from Patel to a quick ball outside off. Not sure how deliberate it was, but it raced to third man
beaten this time as he tries to run one into the off side. An appeal for a stumping but no one other than Umar is very interested
homing in on the stumps straight away, Bairstow aims through the leg side and it takes the pad to short third man

breakthrough for Pakistan, brilliant work from Ajmal and not great from Patel. Was neatly worked to deep square and Patel wanted the second. Ajmal produced a pinpoint throw which hit direct and Patel stretched, but didn't dive, for his crease and ended up a few inches short.
on off stump, pushes his first delivery to backward point
banged in short, Buttler pulls but doesn't really time it out to deep square
full delivery, driven firmly into the pitch and it bounces over Gul down to long-off
blimey, he drilled that. Now Buttler connects with a handsome drive which beats the chasing deep cover
round the wicket, cuts and misses
comes down the pitch and bunts to long-on
on middle, hint of turn, defended to the off side
wrong line from Ajmal, outside leg stump and it takes the pad to beat Umar Akmal and trickles towards the boundary before Afridi chases it down
fired in fast and wide of leg as Ajmal spotted Buttler moving around the crease. Buttler responded with a strong sweep
finishes with a full toss which is worked down the ground
a quick yorker just outside off stump which scoots past the timber as Bairstow plays over the top after giving himself room
speared in towards the pads, Bairstow flicks hard but it comes more off a thick edge out to deep square
gives himself room but can only jab another full delivery into the ground which bounces back towards the keeper
superb yorker, Bairstow swings hard but it comes off the bottom of bat back to Gul
low full toss, just inches away from being perfect, but it only costs a single as Bairstow drives one-handed to long-off
the flip fails again for Buttler. Shapes to flick this over short fine leg but, unlike two days ago, doesn't even make contact. You know the rest
starts with a big, wide, full toss which is driven through the covers and Bairstow is rapid between the wickets to make it a couple
another full toss which he gets away with as it's driven to long-off
he hasn't pitched one yet, although that isn't always bad in this situation. Broad lofts a low full toss over cover between mid-off and deep cover
done like kipper. Lovely slower ball and Broad was so early on the shot he was able to turn around and see his stumps broken.
excellent stuff, full and swinging into Swann who can only push it back to the bowler
finishes with a slower one outside off, Swann just holds back long enough to poke it towards backward point and he'll have the strike
do I need to tell you what this was? OK then. A yorker which is only jabbed to cover
heaved away through the leg side, good running and it takes Bairstow to an excellent fifty - his first at international level. Composed knock.
this time a lack of timing helps Bairstow as he clubs a back-of-a-length delivery down the ground and it falls short of long-off
Quick. Yorker. Outside leg stump. Swing. Miss. Dot
what a blow! Picked the slower ball, but he didn't swing with huge power yet it carried miles back over long-on
gets back to yorker-length, Bairstow drives it hard and straight to cover
